intro: Alyssum erzerumi, commonly known as the Erzerum alyssum, is a flowering plant native to the Caucasus region. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is characterized by its clusters of fragrant, white or pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are usually simple and linear, and it produces small, rounded seed pods that release tiny seeds. Alyssum erzerumi is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
